page.title: 17ASHTON - CONSERVATION 2
page.content:
Butterflies also flourish in the conservation area. Of particular interest locally is the Chequered Skipper, the butterfly which gives its name to the local pub where competitors refresh themselves before, during and after the World Conker Championships held annually on the village green. In October 1985 the event was contested by over one hundred conker buffs from Britain, Germany and the United States, the eventual winner and champion being Mr.Peter Midlaine of Gordon Road, Oundle who had in fact won the event on two previous occasions, a real
{CONKER CONQUEROR
Elsewhere on the Ashton Estate a seed project produces wild flowers for planting on motorway verges.
